== DerootificationStatus ==

The following programs/processes were already successfully "derooted", i. e. the process does not run as root any more, or got its suid root bit removed:

* klogd (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/sysklogd.no-root.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=35325|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* syslogd (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/sysklogd.no-root.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=35325|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* cupsd (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/cupsys.min-privileges.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=263796|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* hald (accepted in Debian, accepted upstream)
* ntpd (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/ntp.no-root.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/298059|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* procmail (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/procmail.minprivs.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/298058|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* smbmount/smbumount (trivial packaging change, not really appropriate for Debian)
* jackd (Ubuntu patch effectively disables realtime feature by installing it non-suid)
* login (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/shadow.login-nosuid.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/298060|BTS]]</nowiki>, adopted in Debian)
* gpg/gnupg (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/gnupg.capabilities.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=260803|BTS]]</nowiki>); completely non-suid in Ubuntu, kernel 2.6.8+ supports mlock() as user
* hpoj (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/hpoj.deroot.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/298064|BTS]]</nowiki>, accepted in Debian)
* at (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/at.deroot.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/295816|BTS]]</nowiki>, accepted in Debian)
* dhcp3-server (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/dhcp3.deroot-server.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/308833|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* unix_chkpwd (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/pam.unix_chkpwd-deroot.diff|pam]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/nis.unix_chkpwd-deroot.diff|nis]]</nowiki> patches sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/155583|BTS]]</nowiki>)
* hplip (accepted in Debian)

The following processes still appear to run with too many privileges by default and should be investigated:
* udevd
* power management daemons
* X
* arpwatch
* vsftpd

The following programs/processes were at one point "derooted" but now run as root:

* dhcp3-client (<nowiki>[[http://patches.ubuntu.com/patches/dhcp3.deroot-client.diff|patch]]</nowiki> sent to Debian <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/308832|BTS]]</nowiki> )
